name: places/ChIJJUh2zMdZwokRwsVawXLRU3s
formattedAddress: 226 W 79th St, New York, NY 10024, USA
adrFormatAddress: 226 W 79th St, New York, NY 10024-6250, USA

originalText.text:
I was excited when I saw a restaurant open in this location again. I loved the old spot and wanted to see the place succeed as a new bar/restaurant. I understand they opened about a month ago, but it seems like there are still a *lot* of kinks to be worked out.
Overall, esp considering the glowing reviews, I was really underwhelmed. The food was under seasoned, the cocktails were watery, the staff were unorganized & there was no flow of service, and it was overall chaotic af. We were sat right next to the kitchen, in the worst spot and were the most ignored table. In an hour dinner, no one stopped by after our initial order, and only after we waited and finally flagged someone for the check did anyone ask if we wanted anything else. For just getting one drink, app, and entree each, it didn‚Äôt feel like it should‚Äôve been a $150 tab, that‚Äôs for sure.

Also, I have no idea why there‚Äôs a velvet curtain leading to the kitchen hanging right next to the fryer, that seems like a really bad idea. And if you‚Äôre gonna go for the bright lights/white aesthetic, then there needs to be more attention to cleaning. I had to just stop looking at the walls and floors.
Overall for the sake of the neighborhood, I hope things get better from here, but I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll be returning.

originalText.text:
Haven is a great addition to West 79th Street and to the UWS.

First and foremost, the food is excellent. The owner, Brian Staub, was there to welcome us‚Ä¶ and we felt there were extra touches along the way that made us truly feel like guests.

My cocktail - the Mezcal pineapple combo (It had a great name, too‚Ä¶ but I cannot remember what it was called) was amazing.

We started with the complimentary white bean dip and veggies (yum!), chicken lollipops - yummy and juicy, ricotta toast - delish!  and Haven salad. All tasted perfect.

Next, we had the burger (outstanding - and even more outstanding because it has an Orwasher‚Äôs bunüòä)  and chicken paillard - a lighter choice that was also delicious. .

We were full‚Ä¶ But how could we pass up the Babka dessert with vanilla ice cream?  It was quite possibly the best dessert I‚Äôve had all year (& I‚Äôve eaten a lot this month!). Just when we feel we were finished‚Ä¶ they brought us outrageously, soft and warm, salted chocolate chip cookies that sealed the deal.

Can‚Äôt wait to go back‚Ä¶ And maybe Brian will morph the front room into a jazzy bar for later night hours‚Ä¶that would be cool.

originalText.text: I am a die-hard Upper West Sider and there is nothing more welcome than a new and unique restaurant in our hood. While it has only been open a little over 2 weeks, I have eaten there a few times and it keeps getting better. The front windows are welcoming and you clearly get the vibe once you enter the space, which is filled with awesome music and friendly staff.  I ate a few times in the back room and once in the 6-top up front and was just as happy in either room.  I would consider myself a low key ‚Äúfoodie‚Äù so I was really intrigued with just about everything on the menu: favs so far are the french onion soup mushrooms, crispy rice with tuna and absolutely LOVED the italian salad ‚Äì omg the dressing!!! God only knows what they put on the Haven burger, but it‚Äôs amazing!  (*My teens by far favored the burger but happily ate just about everything else we ordered too!) The skirt steak is topped with a magical chimichurri and the sliced tuna was just delicious.  I have never loved sweet potato anything but their sweet potato gnocchi is quite special which oozes with a yummy sauce.  One night I sat next to a couple who said Haven‚Äôs kugel was better than her own ‚ÄúKiller Kugel‚Äù and we ended up sharing kugel recipes which only added to the warm and cozy vibe of Haven.  I actually saw a lot of those conversations happen across tables. This place has a community feel that I haven‚Äôt felt in a neighborhood restaurant‚Ä¶maybe ever.  I ended up drinking Haven‚Äôs sauvignon blanc each time which was priced well and tasted delicious.  My husband is an avid beer drinker and has loved the Talea on tap. The wait staff has been super friendly and I am pretty sure a few know me by name, which is also something I have longed for living on the upper west for over 20 years.  While Haven is new and, as with any new restaurant, still working out some kinks, I am looking forward to many more meals there and many drinks at their very cool bar too!

originalText.text: Probably the best gourmet burger I‚Äôve had in the city in a long time! The owner is super humble. I‚Äôve seen them throughout the entire build out and menu process, the owner does not settle for anything less than the highest quality. I couldn‚Äôt be more excited to finally have a good restaurant in the area.

originalText.text: The new UWS restaurant aptly named Haven is perfect in so many ways. Not only is the food delicious and the ambiance beautiful, the restaurant itself feels like a haven. It has a very warm feeling when you walk in, there is a buzz at the bar, and it overall feels incredibly welcoming. The food and atmosphere are spot on!
